intro: Chamaelirium japonicum var. koreanum, commonly known as Korean tansy, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
